data.title: Techron Fuel Injector Cleaner (How much?)
data.text:
725 posts ·

#2 ·

I can't speak about Techron, but the usual recommendation for Seafoam (another fuel additive) is to use the full bottle divided up over several full tanks. For example, if the bottle will treat 15 gallons and you add 5 gallons each time you fill up (I pulled those numbers out of thin air BTW, so don't take them as gospel), then you would use a third of the bottle for three consecutive tanks. I imagine any other additive would be the same.

499 posts ·

#3 ·

I don't see any problem, nor have I had any, adding full more than the "recommended" amount of Techron or other cleaners.

I have an beautiful 1980 Yamaha XS 1100 Special I bought in April, and have run many high concentrations of cleaner (seafoam, Chemtool, Lucas, you name it)through it so far. My thinking is because I don't ride it near as much as the Vee (800 miles since April vs. over 5,000 on the Strom) and usually for errands, etc, that the cleaner sits in there and can work better over time at cleaning/loosening anything up. The bike runs great, so I can't complain. My main concern is varnish in the carbs since that bike only has 13,900 original miles on it, and most of them came in the first 5 years of it's life.

Go for it, it won't hurt anything.

98 posts ·

#4 ·

1oz per gallon

2568 posts ·

#5 ·

Unsure if there is any harm, however why not use it as directed?

Cheers

1872 posts ·

#6 ·

+1, I divide my BG44K up as well. Get a ratio rite if ya don't already have one. Very handy for the shop.

0 Reply

13 posts ·

#7 ·

Don't use too much...

Using too much will leave heavy deposits on spark plug. I would use half a bottle (small size) in one full tank. Actually, it works best to run it through and shut it down (letting the stuff sit over night etc...) Great stuff though, used to use it on Fords to get past smog test... cleans behind the intake vales really good.

9982 posts ·

#8 ·

Probably

Probably won't hurt anything to over-use, but probably more beneficial to add proportionately, over several tankfuls of gas, rather than at higher concentration in one tank, especially if you think you have significant accumulations.

20 posts ·

#9 ·

What rgammie says makes sense about it leaving deposits on the spark plug.

What most members seem to be saying is "more is not necessarily better" and you're probably wasting SeaFoam by using more than the recommended daily allowance.

Use 5 ounces for 5 gallons and save some for your other motorized equipment.

13140 posts ·

#10 ·

when I buy FI cleaner addative, I put about ¼ of the bottle in my bike then dump the rest in my cage
